name: Collective Bargaining Agreement (CBA) Skeleton
description: A high-level framework for negotiating CBAs with unions in Ghana, reflecting Act 651 requirements for mining and manufacturing sectors.

clauses.clause_text: This Agreement is between {{employer_name}} and {{union_name}}. Both parties recognize the Union as the sole collective bargaining agent for the employees in the {{bargaining_unit}} category.

This Agreement shall remain in force for a period of {{duration_years}} years starting from {{effective_date}}. It covers all conditions of employment including wages, hours of work, and disciplinary procedures.
The salary scales for the covered employees are set out in Appendix A. There shall be an annual across-the-board increment of {{annual_increment_percentage}}%, subject to performance reviews.

In the event of a dispute, the parties shall follow the grievance procedure: (1) Informal discussion; (2) Formal written complaint to Management; (3) Mediation; (4) Referral to the National Labour Commission (NLC) in accordance with Section 154 of Act 651.

In case of redundancy, the Employer shall provide at least {{redundancy_notice_months}} months' notice to the Union and the Chief Labour Officer. Severance pay shall be calculated as {{weeks_per_year}} weeks of basic salary for every year of completed service.
